participants.name: Amanda Kapp
participants.url: Went to Washington High School, Phoenix, AZ

messages.message: lol, yes now i understand your halloween costume. very funny - the eyeliner is a nice touch

Brian
Haha, I did it myself.  Maybe a little bit too well.  It was a fun night, have a good rest of the evening Friday?

Nice work - your facial expression is very convincing. Yes, Friday was pretty funny. A friend was showing off her new line of dresses at Sundara, although when I got there everyone just seemed to be working - there wasn't an actual event going on which I thought was odd. And then at the Greenroom there was not a dance performance as far as I could tell, however I did have the benefit of seeing a highly entertaining fashion show - imagine about 250 yards of tulle (you know - what tutus are made out of) and a LOT of feathers - several ostriches worth. Did you make it for the music?

Brian
Wow, that like a crazy fashion show!  I did make it there for music, it was pretty awesome!  Not as great as last week, but definitely some great music.  They have really added a lot of cool lighting to that place in the last year.

Congrats on graduation tomorrow! A diploma with a little snow on top to boot. I forgot I am going to the Nutcracker tomorrow night - sorry to miss. What is this deathstar? Is that your house? Funny, we had friends who called their house The Mothership. Must be a theme there. Cheers!

Brian
Haha.  Yes, The Death Star is the nickname David M and I came up with when we first moved in.  I make it into a location on Google Maps.  Thanks for the well wishes!  We should hang out sometime!
We should! I am not sure what your Flagstaff time line is but let me know if you are around: 526-0583

Brian
Woo! First Friday! Are you going out? We should remind everyone of tacos at Charlie's and Electric Kingdom at Green Room!

Brian Cullinan! 

Hello, how are you? How were your holidays? Mine were good - warm in Tucson and Phoenix and then up here in time for the weather to dip below freezing - elevation is shocking. 

Thank you for the reminder about First Friday. I think this Friday is actually a friend's birthday so the evening agenda may be up to her, however I will let her know and we will see where we end up. 

Hmmmmmm, well, (since the last thing I did was send you my phone number) I should probably mention (and I have to say it is with some sadness that I have to report this to you because you are nice, smart and have this very amazing smile) that I started seeing someone over the break. I know you and I weren't dating or anything but the thought had certainly crossed my mind (perhaps more than once) and so I thought I might mention it.

Anyway, I look forward to bumping into you at taco night...or Safeway for that matter  I should also say that I have enjoyed your music recommendations on FB - since I don't usually listen to techno it is refreshing to hear some new sounds. I may have to use some of these when it is my turn to teach at dance.

Be well, Amanda

Brian
Holidays were great!  I had a ton of fun with family and friends.  I've been out partying a lot since graduation, but I've since been back to Flagstaff to work on projects.  The elevation will definitely get to you.  I haven't adjusted well to the cold this year, but I spent all day yesterday skiing, so hopefully that will help.

Thanks for the heads up on your relationship status.  You are very sweet, and also very attractive on many levels.  Now I kind of feel bad for not calling  The thought crossed my mind on multiple occasions too! 

I am glad you like the music.  I like electronica because there are so many unique noises, and a big part of enjoying the sound, I think, is how the reverberations feel.  Let me know how the dance teaching goes!

Hope to see you Friday, and good luck with the new guy!

-Brian
life is great - how about you?

Brian
Peachy.
Buying a house.  Totally excited about that.

oh that's fantastic!
down in the valley?

oooo - shiney big kitchen
huge yard
Kenney says you are part of a new brainstorming group
building LED cubes and other modern feats of amazement

Brian
Hopefully.  I am no electrical engineer.  But I think the programming challenge will be fun, and it might motivate me to take an EE class.
Can't really say much until it's accomplished.
